Are you telecommuting wishing you had the perfect pet to curl up with? Finding yourself with time to train a wonderful pet?

We can help! While we are not open to the public during the COVID-19 pandemic, we are scheduling appointments at the Madison County Animal Shelter for citizens interested in adopting our furry friends. Visit our website at www.madisoncountyky.us/adopt to find your perfect pet.

Email or Direct Message us to set up an appointment. Adoption fees are as follows:

Dogs and Puppies Adoptions
Fee: $37.10
Adoption includes:
-Partial Vaccination
-Madison County License
-$75 Spay/Neuter Voucher
-Microchip
-Free Vet Checkup

Cats and Kittens Adoptions
Fee: $21.20
Adoption includes:
-Partial Vaccination
-$40 Spay/Neuter Voucher
-Microchip
-Free Vet Checkup

Don't Forget!
1. Bring a way to transport your new friend home. Leashes, collars, and crates are always helpful!
2. Check with landlords and apartment complexes to ensure your landlord allows pets and what restrictions they may have on breeds.

Madison County Judge Executive Reagan Taylor, in consultation with Madison County Fire Chief Tim Gray, lifted the countywide burn ban put into effect by Executive Order on August 9, 2019.
Citizens are still required to adhere to the current Kentucky Forestry Burn Ban that is in effect annually in Kentucky from October 1 through December 15 and February 15 through April 30. This Forestry Ban states it is illegal to burn anything between the hours of 6 a.m. and 6 p.m. within 150 feet of any woodland or brushland. For more information visit https://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/dbnf/alerts-notices/?cid=stelprdb5278374
In addition, citizens residing within the city limits of Richmond and Berea are still required to acquire permits prior to any burning.

Richmond Register
April 22, 2019 at 6:08 PM ·

JAILER STEVE TUSSEY'S COLUMN: In recent months, our facility has garnered media attention for the removal of bad actors from the jail. I want to reiterate what I have said before about my commitment to having an efficient and well-run detention center. Our staff will abide by our legal obligations to report incidents occurring in our facility, we will follow national standards and procedures outlined by the Department of Corrections, and we pledge to be transparent with both law enforcement and the citizens of Madison County about the state of our facility. As Jailer, I am honored and humbled to serve the people of Madison County. I am proud to represent the dedicated staff at the Detention Center who as local sworn law enforcement agents, with the authority and the responsibility to enforce the laws of our great Commonwealth, serve as great community partners.
